preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 1. The pre-processed metabolomics dataset and its associated meta-data if available (see section 4.1).
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 1. The pre-processed metabolomics dataset and its associated meta-data if available (see section 4.1).

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 3. The data exploration report including the results of data investigation, understand- ing and prospecting.
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 3. The data exploration report including the results of data investigation, understand- ing and prospecting.

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 5. The aims of the study and their relationship with the goals of the metabolomics investigation and its hypotheses and assumptions.
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 5. The aims of the study and their relationship with the goals of the metabolomics investigation and its hypotheses and assumptions.

externalSourcesList.description: Scott, I. M., C. P. Vermeer, et al. (2010). "Enhancement of Plant Metabolite Fingerprinting by Machine Learning." Plant Physiology 153(4): 1506-1520.
BaniMustafa, A. (2012). A Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining Process Model for Metabolomics. PhD, University of Wales, Aberystwyth.
lynn Presentation about the experimental design of HiMet Project

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 6. Background information and/or knowledge regarding the data mining, including: its approaches (see section 3.2), goals, tasks (see section 3.3), and techniques (see section 3.4).
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 6. Background information and/or knowledge regarding the data mining, including: its approaches (see section 3.2), goals, tasks (see section 3.3), and techniques (see section 3.4).

externalSourcesList.description: BaniMustafa, A. (2012). A Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining Process Model for Metabolomics. PhD, University of Wales, Aberystwyth.

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 7. Background information regarding the requirements of data mining techniques application, including: time, cost, and expertise as well as the availability of the software and hardware infrastructure.
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 7. Background information regarding the requirements of data mining techniques application, including: time, cost, and expertise as well as the availability of the software and hardware infrastructure.

externalSourcesList.description: BaniMustafa, A. (2012). A Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining Process Model for Metabolomics. PhD, University of Wales, Aberystwyth.
